organizations: Law Office of Martin G. Weinberg, P.C.

relationships.description: Epstein owned the island where Alexander worked

analysis.purpose: To provide sworn affidavit evidence regarding visits by prominent political figures to Epstein's island and assert attorney-client privilege over the communication
analysis.significance: Shows legal team gathering exculpatory evidence about political figure visits to Epstein's property during relevant time period

notable_quotes: I will sign a sworn affidavit that I never met the man. As far as I know President Clinton was never on the Island.
If he had come to the Island while I was on holiday, my staff would have told me that President Clinton was on the Island while I was away.
The same is true for Vice President Gore and his wife Tipper. I never met them and as far as I am aware were never on Little St. James during the entire period that I was the Island manager.

blackmail_indicators.description: No evidence of blackmail or coercion - appears to be standard legal correspondence gathering evidence

illegal_activity.description: Document contains legal correspondence about gathering evidence, no first-hand illegal activity discussed

public_knowledge.context: This appears to be internal legal correspondence that would be of significant media interest given the involvement of Jeffrey Epstein and prominent political figures

analysis.summary: Attorney Martin Weinberg forwards an email from Miles Alexander, former manager of Little St. James island, who provides a sworn affidavit stating that Bill Clinton and Al Gore/Tipper Gore never visited the island during his tenure from 1999-2007, with the communication marked as privileged attorney-client correspondence.
